org.obrel.core

Class ObjectRelations

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.ObjectRelations

  • public class ObjectRelations
extends java.lang.Object
    A class containing static methods for the handling of object relations. This comprises especially the handling of relations for objects that are not subclasses of RelatedObject. For this purpose this class contains static variants of the methods in the Relatable interface, with an additional object parameter that defines an arbitrary target object.

    • Method Detail

      • copyRelations

        public static void copyRelations(Relatable rSource,
                                 Relatable rTarget,
                                 boolean bReplace)
        Copies all relations from a certain object to another object. The relations will be copied recursively so that the relations of the source object's relations (also known as annotations) will be copied too. But the relation targets are only copied by reference. The invoking code is responsible to make sure that the duplication of target references won't cause problems.
        Parameters:
        rSource - The source object to copy the relations from
        rTarget - The target object to copy the relations to
        bReplace - TRUE to replace existing relations, FALSE to keep them

      • fromJson

        public static <T extends Relatable> T fromJson(T rTarget,
                                               java.lang.String sJson)
        Parses a JSON string into the relations of a relatable object. The JSON string must be in a compatible format, e.g. like it is generated by toJson(Relatable, Collection).
        Parameters:
        rTarget - The target for the parsed relations
        sJson - The JSON string to parse
        Returns:
        The target object

      • getRelatable

        public static Relatable getRelatable(java.lang.Object rForObject)
        Returns a relatable object for an arbitrary object that can be used to store relations for that object. The returned Relatable instance will be available as long as the original object has not been garbage collected, even if the calling code does not keep a reference to the returned object. If the argument is a relatable object already it will be returned unchanged.
        Parameters:
        rForObject - The object to return a relatable object for
        Returns:
        A Relatable instance associated with the argument object

      • init

        public static void init()
        Globally initializes the object relations framework. This method should be invoked as early as possible by applications that use object relations. At the moment it only registers the standard relation types that are defined in the classes of the package org.obrel.type by means of the method registerRelationTypes(Class...). But future versions may perform additional tasks and therefore it is recommended to always invoke it.

      • registerRelationTypes

        public static void registerRelationTypes(java.lang.Class<?>... rClasses)
        Registers all relation types that are defined in the given classes. Normally a relation type is registered automatically when it is used for the first time but there are possible situations where that may not have happened yet. A typical case is the deserialization of a related object which contains relations of a type class that hasn't been loaded at the time of deserialization.

        For this reason applications should always register the relation types they use for all classes that contain application-defined relation types. This can be done either at initialization time (i.e. on application start) or (if possible) on demand when a type is accessed for the first time (e.g. by using a special relation type superclass with a static initializer that invokes this method).

        Because this method may be extended in the future to provide support for enhanced features (like distributed object spaces or remote relations) applications should always register relation types by invoking this method instead of simply loading the class that defines the types.

        Parameters:
        rClasses - A list of classes to register all defined types of

      • removeRelatable

        public static void removeRelatable(java.lang.Object rForObject)
        Removes the relatable object that has been associated previously with a certain object. If no relatable object exists calling this method will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        rForObject - The object to remove the relatable object for

      • require

        public static void require(Relatable rRelatable,
                           RelationType<?>... rTypes)
        Validates that certain relations exist on a target object or else throws an IllegalArgumentException.
        See Also:
        require(Relatable, Predicate, RelationType...)

      • require

        public static void require(Relatable rRelatable,
                           Predicate<Relation<?>> pRequirement,
                           RelationType<?>... rTypes)
        Validates that certain relations exist on a target object and fulfill certain requirements or else throws an IllegalArgumentException. Non-existing relations with one of the given types will cause an immediate exception. All others will be tested with the argument predicate of which a return value of FALSE will also yield an exception.
        Parameters:
        rRelatable - The relatable to validate
        pRequirement - A predicate that tests whether a relation fulfills the requirements
        rTypes - The relation types that must be set on the object with any kind of value, including NULL
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one or more relations don't exist or the requirement predicate yields FALSE

      • requireNonNull

        public static void requireNonNull(Relatable rRelatable,
                                  RelationType<?>... rTypes)
        Validates that certain relations exist on a target object with a non-null value or else throws an IllegalArgumentException.
        See Also:
        require(Relatable, Predicate, RelationType...)

      • setAll

        public static <T> void setAll(RelationType<T> rType,
                              T rTarget,
                              Relatable... rObjects)
        A helper method to set a certain relation on multiple objects.
        Parameters:
        rType - The type of the relation to set
        rTarget - The relation target value
        rObjects - The objects to set the relation on

      • setFlags

        public static void setFlags(RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> rFlagType,
                            Relatable... rObjects)
        A helper method to set a certain boolean relation to TRUE on multiple objects.
        Parameters:
        rFlagType - The boolean type of the relation
        rObjects - The objects to set the flag on

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown()
        Performs a shutdown by freeing global resources.

      • swapRelations

        public static void swapRelations(RelatedObject rFirst,
                                 RelatedObject rSecond)
        Swaps the relations of two objects. All relations will be exchanged directly between the two objects, making the first object contain only the relations of the second and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        rFirst - The first object to swap the relations of the second to
        rSecond - The second object to swap the relations of the first to

      • syncRelations

        public static void syncRelations(RelatedObject rTarget,
                                 RelatedObject rSource)
        Synchronizes the relations of a target object with that of a source object. All previous relations of the target object will be deleted and instead both objects will refer to the same relations and changes to the relations will be visible in both objects.
        Parameters:
        rTarget - The target object to replace the relations of
        rSource - The object replace the target object's relations with

      • toJson

        public static java.lang.String toJson(Relatable rObject,
                                      RelationType<?>... rRelationTypes)
        Converts a relatable object into a JSON string from the object's relations. If no relation types are provided all relations of the object will be converted to JSON. In that case it is important that there are no cycles in the relations (i.e. objects referring each other) or else an endless loop will occur. Furthermore all relations in the source object must be convertible to strings, i.e. should either have a basic (JSON) datatype or a conversion to string registered with Conversions.registerStringConversion(Class, de.esoco.lib.expression.InvertibleFunction). If not the resulting JSON string will probably not be parseable by the method fromJson(Relatable, String).
        Parameters:
        rObject - The object to convert
        rRelationTypes - The types of the relation to be converted to JSON (none for all)
        Returns:
        The resulting JSON string

      • toJson

        public static java.lang.String toJson(Relatable rObject,
                                      java.util.Collection<RelationType<?>> rRelationTypes)
        Converts a certain relations of a relatable object into a JSON string from the object's relations. References to other related objects are converted recursively.
        Parameters:
        rObject - The object to convert
        rRelationTypes - The types of the relation to be converted to JSON
        Returns:
        The resulting JSON string

      • urlDelete

        public static void urlDelete(Relatable rRoot,
                             java.lang.String sUrl)
        Deletes a relation referenced by a URL. The URL will be split into relation type names that are looked up recursively from the relation hierarchy starting at the given root object. That means all intermediate elements of the URL must refer to Relatable instances. If the hierarchy doesn't match the URL an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        rRoot - The root relatable to start the URL lookup at
        sUrl - The URL of the relation to get the value from
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the URL could not be resolved
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the URL doesn't resolve to a valid relation type

      • urlGet

        public static java.lang.Object urlGet(Relatable rRoot,
                                      java.lang.String sUrl)
        Returns a relation value referenced by a URL. The URL will be split into relation type names that are looked up recursively from the relation hierarchy starting at the given root object. That means all intermediate elements of the URL must refer to Relatable instances. If the hierarchy doesn't match the URL an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        rRoot - The root relatable to start the URL lookup at
        sUrl - The URL of the relation to get the value from
        Returns:
        The value at the given URL
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the URL could not be resolved
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the URL doesn't resolve to a valid relation type

      • urlPut

        public static void urlPut(Relatable rRoot,
                          java.lang.String sUrl,
                          java.lang.Object rValue)
        Sets or updates a relation value referenced by a URL. The URL will be split into relation type names that are looked up recursively from the relation hierarchy starting at the given root object. That means all intermediate elements of the URL must refer to Relatable instances. If the hierarchy doesn't match the URL an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        rRoot - The root relatable to start the URL lookup at
        sUrl - The URL of the relation to update
        rValue - The new or updated value
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the URL could not be resolved
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the URL doesn't resolve to a valid relation type or if the given value cannot be assigned to the relation type

      • urlResolve

        public static java.lang.Object urlResolve(Relatable rRoot,
                                          java.lang.String sUrl,
                                          boolean bForwardToObjectSpace,
                                          ObjectSpaceResolver fTargetHandler)
        Performs a lookup of a relation through a URL by splitting it into relation type names and if possible recursively applying them to the hierarchy of relatable objects referenced by the relations types. If the URL could be successfully resolved the target handler will be invoked. This must be a binary function that receives the target relatable and relation type (representing the second-to-last and last URL elements) and return either a result value or NULL if the arguments are just consumed.
        Parameters:
        rRoot - The root relatable for the lookup
        sUrl - The URL to resolve
        bForwardToObjectSpace - TRUE if the resolving should be forwarded to an object space on the first level instead of resolving a relation
        fTargetHandler - The target handler function
        Returns:
        The result of the function evaluation
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If some element of the URL could not be resolved
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the URL doesn't resolve to a valid relation type
